Fields.DialogueText: Woah!
Oh! I'm sorry, I didn't mean to bump into you like that, Hiryū. I didn't see you there.
Not to worry, Kanchou. It happens all the time.

Fields.MenuText: Why don't you speak up for yourself, then?
That sounds like a pretty sad existence...
You should really learn to be more assertive. We don't need any passive people in the fight against Morganas.

Fields.DialogueText: Speak up for myself? Just because you accidentally bumped me? That seems unnecessary.
There are far worse existences than merely being bumped into on occasion.
Who said that I'm not an assertive fighter? My passivity outside of battle doesn't necessarily reflect on my attitude in battle.
I guess I can't argue with you there...
How about this? There are Funayūrei approaching us right now. I'll show you exactly how well I can fight.
@BATTLE
What do you have to say now, Kanchou?
I must admit, you're a prime example of why I shouldn't judge a book by its cover. Keep up the excellent work.
Ryōkai!
Morganas, dead ahead! Man your stations!
We're on it, Kanchou!
@BATTLE
Again, that was an excellent effort on your part, Hiryū.
Thank you! I'm always working on my technique.
I wish everyone on this ship had that kind of enthusiasm. What's your motivation?
I try my best to channel the flying dragon - my namesake - into every battle.
The flying dragon? How's that?
I see it as symbolizing a person who strives toward achieving life's greatest accomplishments.

Fields.MenuText: Well, I'd say you're well on your way to becoming that person!
I don't quite understand yet. Can you elaborate?
Your amazing captain can certainly help you get there!

Fields.DialogueText: You're making me blush!...Ahem. Arigato gozaimasu.
Perhaps just watch me go about my day, Kanchou. Maybe that will give you a better understanding.
I'll welcome any help you're willing to give.
Hopefully, we can both learn from each other, Hiryū.
That would be wonderful, Kanchou.
Hiryū! Could you possibly spare a moment of your time? I have a question for you.
Absolutely! What do you need?
I heard that you've given some impressive lectures for the National Spiritual Mobilization movement on thrift, hygiene, and hard work.
Could you give those lectures to the crew? I think it would be good for them to hear.
Of course! I am always happy to speak about important matters.

Fields.MenuText: Is there any way you could start with thrift? The spending on this ship gets out of hand in port.
Focus a little more on hygiene. There are a few people on this ship who need to learn a lesson or two...
Hard work is most important to me. I'd like to see you light a fire under the crew.

Fields.DialogueText: Absolutely! I've noticed how excited everyone gets when we near the shore.
Certainly. Some of the men on this ship are a little more...ripe than they ought to be.
I can whip them into shape! I won't give up until every single one of them is giving their all.
I appreciate your work, Hiryū.
Hopefully, I can be of even more help against those Morganas over there.
Morganas! Off the port bow!
@BATTLE
Hiryū, I cannot thank you enough for speaking to the crew!
It wasn't a problem, Kanchou. I enjoyed doing it.
The crew seems to have really enjoyed it as well. You're quite the wordsmith.
Well... I guess so...
Don't be so modest! You absolutely are.
I do try to write poetry in my spare time...

Fields.MenuText: Really? If it's anything like your public speaking, then I'm sure it's amazing.
Don't you think that's kind of... a waste of time on this ship?
Do you think I'd be able to read some of it one day?

Fields.DialogueText: No, no, no. I assure you, it's nothing special...
Maybe so... but it helps keep me sane.
I might show you some if I ever improve. Right now, I just have a lot of works in progress that I wouldn't dream of showing anyone else.
When do you find the time to write?
In between battles with Morganas and my regular duties on the ship.
Then I suppose now wouldn't be a good time to write. Morganas ahead!
@BATTLE
Ow! Hiryū! What in the world are you doing?
Nothing, Kanchou... I'm sorry for crashing into you like that. I'll be on my way, now.
No, wait. Now I'm curious. What were you doing just then?
Just some exercises to... to help with my balance.

Fields.MenuText: Judging by that display, I can tell that you really need them.
What exactly have you been doing to help it?
Do you need any help with it?

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, Kanchou. I realize... I'm really trying, though.
Balancing books on my head and maneuvering through tight spaces. That sort of thing.
I appreciate the offer, but this is something I'd like to do alone. I'm a little embarrassed about this.
Don't worry too much. I'm sure you'll get there.
Thank you... Forget all this, though. We need to focus on those Morganas!
@BATTLE
Hiryū... you're so graceful in battle. Are you sure you're clumsy?
I know I am, but I guess it's just easier for me to immerse myself in the fight and forget about messing up.
Then you just need to channel that into your everyday life. Perhaps living in the moment will help even more than those exercises of yours.
That's a good idea. I'll give it a try.
*ALARM*
Morganas, dead ahead! Man your stations!
We're on it, Kanchou!
@BATTLE
Kanchou, that battle reminded me of something I wanted to ask you.
What is it, Hiryū?
Is there any way we can better train the crew?
Why are you so concerned? We've won that last battle, after all.
It's not about winning, exactly. I've found that the best way to strengthen the soul is through training and battle.
It's seemed to me that the crew's souls could use a little invigoration, and I thought that further training would be just the way to do it!

Fields.MenuText: Hm... I suppose I can't argue with extra training.
I've actually noticed the same thing. This ship needs some more vim and vigor!
If I'm being completely honest, I'm not too concerned about the vitality of the ship. I think the crew's souls are fine and the training will not be necessary.

Fields.DialogueText: Exactly! Two birds with one stone!
That's what I'm saying! The ship has such a sad atmosphere. We should brighten their souls.
I will abide by your decision, but I hope you will reconsider whether that's best for your crew.
Damn... I suppose this can be a rather sad ship...
Don't blame yourself for that. The crew just needs to change their attitude.
Konnichiwa, Kanchou!
Hello, Hiryū! What's that you're reading?
Just a little book of poetry by Walt Whitman. Are you interested in poetry at all?

Fields.MenuText: I honestly don't know a thing about poetry. I'd definitely like to learn, though.
Of course! T.S. Eliot, W.B. Yeats, Robert Frost... The list goes on forever.
I can't understand a word of it, and I don't bother to try.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, everyone has to start somewhere! I'd highly recommend reading anything you can get your hands on. It opened up a whole new world for me.
It delights me to hear that! It's not very often that I meet someone so interested in the art of words. I brought a lot of books with me. You can borrow them any time!
That's a shame... I'm sure if you found a piece that you connected with, it would make it easier for you to understand.
Perhaps I could read some of your work?
Kanchou! I told you my works aren't ready for the public eye.
There's no chance that you would need an editor?
I really don't feel comfortable sharing my poetry...I still need to work on it.
Are you sure?
Yes, I'm sure. Let's not talk about this right now. Come on, we have to go take care of those Morganas.
@BATTLE
Hello, Hiryū. I can see that you're taking full advantage of this peaceful day.
Yes, Kanchou. It's not often that I get to relax like this.
Would you mind if I sat with you?
Of course not. Would you like some dried chestnuts?
Do you just carry those around with you? They're quite delicious.
I know! I always make sure to pick up a couple of bags whenever we dock. Is there anything that you would like to get?

Fields.MenuText: Between you and me, I love to stock up on sweets. They're a guilty pleasure of mine.
I like to collect different little trinkets that relate to the culture of whatever port we dock in. It's an easy way to keep track of my memories.
It may sound simple, but I like to just get paper and ink. I like logging all of our adventures aboard this ship.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't be ashamed of that! We all like to indulge sometimes.
That's a great idea! I can't believe I've never thought of that before. I should start doing that too.
That's brilliant! There are some crazy things that have happened. I definitely want to remember all of them. Maybe if you let me read your logs, I'll let you read my poetry?
Yeah, it's the little things that make being on this ship more comfortable.
And it's the Morganas who always come in and ruin things!
Damn it, what a way to end such a relaxing day... Everyone, be at the ready! The enemy approaches!
@BATTLE
Hiryū, can you do me a favor... Is that jazz music?
No! Absolutely not! That would be ridiculous!
Are you sure? That sounded a lot like jazz...
Nothing so frivolous, Kanchou! Forgive the suggestion, but perhaps you simply misheard. I was listening to...to...the Kimigayo.
What's the Kimigayo?
It's the national anthem of Japan. It serves to glorify the Emperor and wish him a long reign...In fact, did you know-
Wait! Don't try to distract me! That was most definitely jazz music, and you can't tell me any differently.
I swear! It wasn't... Not jazz...
...It was jazz...
Why are you so embarrassed?
Jazz isn't from my culture! I feel like I'm...neglecting Japan or something. But it's just so-
-Catchy, right? It's hard not to like it. You can be patriotic and still like jazz.
Is that your favorite kind of music?

Fields.MenuText: Yes, ma'am! I'm assuming you've heard of Louis Armstrong? His music gets my toe tapping every time!
You might make fun of me, but I love country music. Vernon Dalhart gets me through when I'm having a tough day.
It's a little obscure, but there's this new jazz singer I like. His name escapes me...Sinatra, I think?

Fields.DialogueText: Louis Armstrong is good, but there are so many other musicians besides him! I can show you some of the more unknown ones.
I wouldn't dream of making fun of you, Kanchou!...No matter how tempting it might be.
I can't say I know him.
Do you still feel bad about liking jazz now?
I suppose not.
Captain! You're needed on deck! The Morganas are back!
@BATTLE
I'll show you one of his songs sometime. He's not too big yet, but I think he's going places.
So that one was "It's Funny to Everyone But Me." Brand new.
You're right, Kanchou. I could listen to him for hours. You said this was Frank Sinatra?
And the Harry James Orchestra.
I will have to keep an ear out for him. His voice is so...oh, what's the word?
Musical?
Hai, of course, but there's a certain quality about it I can't place. This is going to bother me...

Fields.MenuText: His range is astounding.
He sure can hold a note.
He sings with such clarity. You wouldn't even know he's from Jersey.

Fields.DialogueText: That's what I was looking for! I love the way tenors push the boundaries of the male voice.
Indeed! The right sort of training can confer incredible breath control.
New Jersey? That is a surprise. Music has a way of equalizing accents, doesn't it? Diction, pronunciation...
Still bashful about jazz?
Less so now. I thought it undisciplined to stray from the trappings of the Empire, but even jazz has a discipline all its own.
You have to know the rules to break them.
@BATTLE
Why, Kanchou, are you trying to corrupt me?
Is it working?
Pending our glorious victory. Let us show these Morganas just how disciplined we are!
Well, well, well. What have we here, Hiryū?
Kanchou! Must you sneak up on me? That isn't very nice, you know?
But it's the best way to keep an eye on my crew...
That doesn't mean you have to do it constantly!
Those steps...were you practicing ballroom dancing?
Oh no, look! Morganas! I guess this conversation is over...
How convenient...
@BATTLE
You can't get out of this conversation, Miss Ballroom Dancer.
No, please don't do this to me!

Fields.MenuText: I had to! It was just so sad seeing you dance by yourself.
Maybe I won't... you did already embarrass yourself quite a bit.
What if I were to tell you that you're not the only one interested in ballroom dancing?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, that's what happens when you don't have a partner.
That was quite rude of you... I'm trying my best!
What are you getting at, Kanchou?
What if I practiced with you? Then we could look ridiculous together.
I suppose it can't hurt. I trust your taste in dance is equal to your taste in music.
I have some work to attend to, but once I'm done, I'll be looking forward to our first practice session!
Are you ready to get started, Hiryū?
I'm a little nervous, but...I guess I'm ready.
Why are you nervous? Everything will be fine!
You're right, you're right. Do you...know where to begin?

Fields.MenuText: You just kind of...move your feet a little bit, right?
Is this the part where I spin you?
What's the point in guessing if I know I'll be wrong?

Fields.DialogueText: You're not wrong, strictly speaking. There is a pattern to everything.
You have to know the rules to break them, remember?
It's okay, you're a beginner. I'll teach you!
So what is the first step?
Since we're going to be dancing the waltz, it's called a box step, which is fairly self-explanatory.
So you just kind of move in a square?
Yes, exactly! Let's just work on that first...
Sorry for interrupting, but the Morganas are back and they're moving in quickly!
We'll resume this later.
@BATTLE
Hiryū, are you in there?
Hai, Kanchou. Is something wrong?
No, nothing wrong. I just wanted to show you something.
What is it?
Well, you know how you refuse to show me your poetry?
Yes...

Fields.MenuText: I thought that if I let you read my captain's log, you'd be more willing.
I tried to put together a piece of prose in the hopes that it would be an equal exchange.
Well, I also tried to write a little bit of poetry, but it probably pales in comparison to what you can write.

Fields.DialogueText: We'll have to see about that. I don't know if a log is equivalent to personal poetry.
Really? You tried to do that for me? What's it about?
Don't say that! Mine isn't even that good. I'm sure yours is better!
Here, just read it.
Captain, the Morganas are back! We need you on deck.
I guess we can continue reading later...
@BATTLE
Hiryū, would you like to go for a walk around the deck with me?
That sounds like fun!... Actually, we should probably take care of those Morganas on the horizon first.
@BATTLE
I'm sorry that our reading session was cut short the other day.
It's fine. There's plenty of time to do it another day.
Will you actually show me your poetry on another day?
It depends on my mood.

Fields.MenuText: It depends on your mood? I'm going to be persistent about this, you know?
All right, I respect your decision. I hope the day comes when you feel comfortable enough to show me.
What else do you want me to do? I really want to see your poetry.

Fields.DialogueText: The amount of effort you put in won't affect me. If I don't want to do something, I won't let anyone change my mind. You should respect that.
Thank you, I appreciate that. I'll let you know if any of my poems are ever prepared.
It's not a matter of what you do; it's my comfort level. I'm just not there yet. I'm sorry.
Okay, have it your way. I'm sure you're an amazing poet.
Flattery will get you nowhere, Kanchou. Haha!
Haha!
That was a great dance lesson, Hiryū!
It was! You did a great job.
Thank you, but... maybe I could lead next time?
I suppose you're now good enough for that. If it helps your ego, yes, you can lead next time.
Very encouraging, Hiryū...
Well, maybe if you'd actually listen to me during the lessons...
Hey, what do you want from me? I'm doing my best!
I know you are, and you're doing a very good job.

Fields.MenuText: You too! How long have you been dancing?
Are you sure? It's okay if you're getting fed up with me already.
Do you think I'm better than you, yet?

Fields.DialogueText: The dancing was different in Japan. I only picked up ballroom dancing recently.
Of course I'm sure! And I wouldn't get fed up with you. I enjoy our time together.
With time, I'm sure you will be. You'll have to be dedicated, though.
These Morganas certainly seem intent on disrupting our practices...
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
It's a stealth attack! Everyone, to your stations, now! Hiryū!
I'm right here, Kanchou!
@BATTLE
Hiryū! I don't know what we would have done without your quick response today. Thank you.
You don't have to thank me at all. It's my duty to protect you and the rest of the ship.

Fields.MenuText: Please, I insist. Let me buy you a gift the next time we dock.
All right, I guess I can't force you to accept my praise.
Hiryū, from the bottom of my heart, thank you very, very, very much.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, no! That's far too much. I didn't really do anything special, honestly!
I was just doing my duty to the Empire. No thanks are needed.
I'm certain you're just mocking me now. There's really no need for that much of a thank you!
You practically saved my life out there.
I needed to. You're my friend. I can't stand to see my friends in danger.
You consider us friends?
Fire-forged. Don't you?
Definitely.
Hello, Hiryū! Hey... what's wrong? You seem kind of down.
Don't worry about me. I'll be fine.
Come on, please tell me. You look distracted.
It's the stupidest thing. Nothing you should be concerned about.
I am concerned, though...
@BATTLE
What's wrong?
Do you dream often, Kanchou?

Fields.MenuText: Like when I'm asleep? Heh, sure I have, but I don't always remember them.
I've always dreamed of being a captain, and look where I am today!
I did have a dream at one point, but... that was in the past. I can't go back and change anything.

Fields.DialogueText: I wasn't trying to be funny. I was asking you a serious question.
Oh... I'm very happy for you, then. You're a lucky person.
You never know. I always say that it's not too late for anything you're passionate about.
Why are you asking?
I have the best tools the Yokosuka shipyard could give me. When, as last night, I dream of defeat...of squandering their potential...it scares me.
I wouldn't worry about that. You've proven yourself on the battlefield and off. How many ships teach their captains to dance between victories?
Thank you, Kanchou. I will try to live in the moment, as you say. I'm happy to share it with you.
*ALARM*
Morganas! We need to fight them, but please don't leave after. I am actually worried.
When I was commissioned I was the world's fastest carrier. I was built to be one of a kind...the pride of the Imperial Navy.
Hah!
Too slow, Kanchou! Let's take this spar from the beginning.
You're lucky you're left-handed.
Did my grip give it away?
Hahaha, don't sass me, Hiryū.
I saw the opportunity and I took it.

Fields.MenuText: Aren't there superstitions about left-handedness?
That must give you an advantage in combat.
Apparently, left-handed people are better at multitasking. I'm not sure if I believe that one, though.

Fields.DialogueText: When my work here is done, there will not be!
Most never bother to learn their forms backwards. It's a serious oversight. But I would be arrogant to rely on it.
You are in no position to make fun, Kanchou!
It's like dancing, isn't it?
In that there are steps, yes. But one must always seek to control the flow of a fight. To lead, you might say.
Those Morganas look like they need partners...
@BATTLE
All the more reason to practice!
Hitting the books, I see.
Rereading some Aizawa. He's a central political theorist in the field of kokutai. National identity, you could call it.
What does that mean to you?
I don't know that you'd want to follow me down that trail, Kanchou.
Heh, you don't think I'd be able to keep up?
Never! I know you're intelligent. It concerns duty and sacrifice...Kanchou. What do you think is the ultimate sacrifice?

Fields.MenuText: Dying for someone you love, no question about it.
It's really about giving all you can for those you hold dearest.
That's a really tough question... I guess it all depends on the person.

Fields.DialogueText: Do you really think that that's the only way it can be done?
I would do that. I would most certainly do that. I need to...
But what if there's a person who has no idea what they can do to make the ultimate sacrifice?
Hiryū, why are you asking me this?
I'm just...I I know it's my duty to give my all for the country, for the war effort. Is it wrong to feel that sort of devotion to a person? Is it one or the other? If I fail in both-
Hiryū! Slow down! You need to take life one day at a time. You've done so much for everyone on this ship.
Maybe... but it's not enough...
Look, I... Damn it, the Morganas. Everyone, prepare for battle!
@BATTLE
Hiryū, I promise everything will be okay.
Morganas, dead ahead! Man your stations!
We're on it, Kanchou!
@BATTLE
Hiryū, are you okay?!
Yes, yes. I'm fine.
You took quite the fall there!
I'm a very, very clumsy person. You know that.
Oh, Hiryū. You're fine the way you are... Wait, what are these?
Nothing! Give me those!
Is this...is this your poetry?
Give it back.

Fields.MenuText: No. Now that I finally have my hands on it, I'm going to read it.
Fine... here.
What's the harm? It's all out here for everyone to see anyway...

Fields.DialogueText: Don't you dare do that!
... Thanks.
Just give it back. I will not ask a second time.
I'm sorry.
It's...fine. I'm going to go back to my cabin now.
Are you busy right now, Kanchou?
That would be a yes.
@BATTLE
Kanchou! I couldn't stop thinking about how angry I was with you the other day. I feel so guilty, I didn't mean to get so mad. Please accept my apologies.

Fields.MenuText: I am your captain. How could you speak out of turn like that?
I should be the one apologizing.
There's nothing to forgive. It's fine.

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou, please! I'm so very sorry...I thought I was more than just your subordinate...
I appreciate that. I can't stand you being upset with me.
Thank you so much. It's still a sensitive matter for me.
No, you're right. I'm sorry. You've told me more than once to respect your privacy, and you don't need to justify it to me.
Thank you for understanding, Kanchou. Although...if you are still interested...
Is this your poetry? I know how much this means to you.
I've done some thinking. It means a lot to me... but so do you. If you'll respect my efforts, I would be happy to share my work.
You're wonderful, Hiryū. Thank you.
*ALARM*
Hiryū? Are you there?
Yes, Kanchou. Was there something you needed?
Nothing in particular, but... I had the chance to read over your poetry.
You did? Are you... Was it... Did I... Was it a mistake?
I want to find you, where the autumn wind comes in, somewhere in the dark.
Oh, goodness, those are my words. What did you think of them?

Fields.MenuText: Honestly, they're a little cheesy. I loved it nonetheless.
I don't know if you could handle that kind of criticism...
It was amazing! It sent chills down my spine. They're such powerful words.

Fields.DialogueText: No one ever said a little bit of cheese was a bad thing.
Oh, dear...please keep it constructive, at least?
Oh, no, you don't mean... Thank you, Kanchou. That's very kind of you to say.
No matter what it said, it's amazing because it came from you.
I can't tell you how much that means to me.
You know I'm here to support you. Tell me more about it?
*ALARM*
...But first I need you to support me in this battle.
@BATTLE
Hiryū, remember how you taught me how to dance?
Yes?
Well, you were such a great teacher and I thought... maybe you could teach me how to write poetry now.
Are you serious? You want me to teach you how to write?
I'm as serious as the grave.
Dark, but...I'll teach you! We can start now unless...unless those are Morganas on the horizon.
It most certainly is them.
@BATTLE
Now, where would you like to start with the poetry? I know haikus the best, but we could start anywhere you'd like!

Fields.MenuText: Haikus are fine with me! I'd like to get the best lesson possible.
Maybe we could work on some romantic sonnets?
We could start with limericks to reflect my amazing sense of humor.

Fields.DialogueText: Great choice!
Kanchou! Getting a little saucy, are we?
Now that is funny...
So what's the first step?
The basis of all this is words, obviously...
I can't hear you?!

Fields.MenuText: This isn't ordinary weather. This is Morgana territory.
That sound...could it be...
I need to call action stations. It's too dangerous to be out here.

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou! The Morganas are back!
Kanchou! The Morganas are back!
Kanchou! The Morganas are back!
What was that?!
The Morganas! Kanchou, watch out!
Brace yourselves!
@BATTLE
What a fight that was. Are you all right?
Souka, Kanchou. Some of those shells were headed too close for comfort. If I hadn't cut them down, you...you would have...
Since this war started, I've seen many impossible things. You're amazing with that sword. But you didn't need to do that.
I couldn't leave you! I will sacrifice all I have for my friends... for you. If I did nothing else with myself, that would be enough.
Hiryū! You've done so much for me, and I would never expect you to do any more than you already have, especially not putting yourself so close to danger.
Are... are you sure?
Yes. Now please go rest. You probably need it.
Thank you for meeting me out here on the deck tonight.
Why did you want me to come out here? Was it to fight those Morganas?
Damn it... They always ruin everything.
@BATTLE
What was the real reason you wanted me to meet you out here?
I just wanted to show you something.
What's that?
White streak against black, the foggy moon is obscured, we fight them as one.
Did you write that?
Yeah... was it okay?
It was... amazing. I loved it.
Hiryū...

Fields.MenuText: You're such a good friend. I'm so happy you chose me as your captain.
I think you're amazing.

Fields.DialogueText: I know the decision was the right one.
That... that's so sweet of you, Kanchou.
How about another poetry lesson?
Tanka, perhaps? I think you're ready.
